qas.question: What newspaper was founded by Express Newspaper?
By what year had The Daily Star started impacting The Sun's sales?
What helped the Sun overcome the Daily Star's challenge?

answers.text: Bingo was introduced as a marketing tool and a 2p drop in cover price

qas.question: Who became editor of the Sun in 1981?
What impact was Mackenzie said to have?

answers.text: changed the British tabloid concept more profoundly than [Larry] Lamb did"

context: <a0_0>The Daily Star<a0_0/> had been launched in 1978 by Express Newspaper, and by <a1_0>1981<a1_0/> had begun to affect sales of The Sun. <a2_0>Bingo was introduced as a marketing tool and a 2p drop in cover price<a2_0/> removed the Daily Star's competitive advantage opening a new circulation battle which resulted in The Sun neutralising the threat of the new paper. The new editor of The Sun, <a3_0>Kelvin MacKenzie<a3_0/>, took up his post in 1981 just after these developments, and "<a4_0>changed the British tabloid concept more profoundly than [Larry] Lamb did"<a4_0/>, according to Bruce Page, MacKenzie The paper became "more outrageous, opinionated and irreverent than anything ever produced in Britain".
